item.title: The Metagame
item.description: Nearly a year ago I did a workshop at York University about game analysis in esport. One of the questions that were asked to Luis and I was: How do you define the meta? And we struggled to answer. I remember Luis saying that the meta could change from a match to another so I want to try answer this question here. Simply put, the meta represents “the strongest elements of a game to achieve victory”.

item.title: Players performance rating in League
item.description: Last week Riot published this article. While the damage rating part is fine, I think the method for their overall ranking is really too subjective and mathematically questionable. In my previous article I wrote about stats importance ranking. What I do is that I give all the stats to a machine learning algorithm and it returns me coefficients of importance for each stat. What Riot does is ask pro players and analyst what stats they think are the most important.

item.title: Performance rating in League
item.description: When we try to evaluate teams or player performances we tend to look at very specific information. First blood rate, first tower rate, farm efficiency, kills, death … etc. But we are blind on the real value of these stats toward a team or player win probabilities. Usually you are going to see something like “Win rate goes up to 80% after getting first Baron Kill”. That’s a nice stat but you’ve learn nothing new, Baron Buff and Gold help close the game.

item.title: Guardian Angel versus Zz’Rot Portal
item.description: Guardian Angel has been quite popular on top lane and jungle in the first weeks of EU LCS. Indeed it’s been purchased 62 times when Zz’Rot Portal was purchased only 6 time in 63 games. Which is a huge difference for such similar items. The combat stats are worth 91.3% of Zz’Rot Portal’s price and only 82.75% for the Guardian Angel. This makes Zz’Rot a way better item if we look only at the combat stats.
